article.headline: Drexel 66, VA Commonwealth 64
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. (AP) -- Bashir Mason's 3-pointer at the buzzer gave Drexel a 66-64 victory over Virginia Commonwealth on Wednesday night. After Renardo Dixon gave the Rams a 64-63 lead with a 3-pointer with 2.7 seconds remaining, Mason flung a one-hander falling toward the sideline and got the win for Drexel (6-6, 2-2 Colonial Athletic Association). That gave the Rams (6-7, 2-2) the second consecutive home loss on a 3-pointer in the last 3 seconds. Virginia Commonwealth led 34-31 at halftime on a dunk by Dixon. The Dragons had a 10-0 run midway through the second half, leading by as many as five points. Alexander Harper's 3-pointer with 3:31 remaining gave the Rams a 56-54 lead and was the first of seven lead changes over the final minutes. Dixon's career-high 18 points led the Rams and Michael Doles added 10. Sean Brooks led the Dragons with a season-high 21 points. Danny Hinds matched his career high with 16 points and Dominick Mejia came off the bench to add 11.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
